required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dynamics of the Capillary Lactate Levels in OHCA
clinical_study.official_title: Dynamics of the Capillary Lactate Levels in Patients With Out-of-hospital Cardiac Arrest

brief_summary.textblock: Serial capillary lactate measurements during cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) in patients with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA).

detailed_description.textblock: Capillary lactate measurements will be measured every ten minutes during CPR in OHCA.

primary_outcome.description: In patients with ROSC the capillary lactate level will be lower compare to the non ROSC group.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison between primary and secondary cardiac arrest
primary_outcome.description: Initial and serial values of capillary lactate will be lower in patients with primary out-of- hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA)
Serial values of capillary lactate will be higher in patients without ROSC

intervention.description: In this study capillary lactate will be measured every 10 minute during CPR.

study_pop.textblock: For this study will be eligible all patients with OHCA due to primary or secondary cardiac arrest.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adults with OHCA
Exclusion Criteria:
- children with OHCA
- trauma
- hypothermia

facility.name: Community health center Maribor, Prehospital unit

reference.citation: Lurie KG, Nemergut EC, Yannopoulos D, Sweeney M. The Physiology of Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation. Anesth Analg. 2016 Mar;122(3):767-783. doi: 10.1213/ANE.0000000000000926. Review.
Patil KD, Halperin HR, Becker LB. Cardiac arrest: resuscitation and reperfusion. Circ Res. 2015 Jun 5;116(12):2041-9. doi: 10.1161/CIRCRESAHA.116.304495. Review.

Corral Torres E, Hernández-Tejedor A, Suárez Bustamante R, de Elías Hernández R, Casado Flórez I, San Juan Linares A. Prognostic value of venous blood analysis at the start of CPR in non-traumatic out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: association with ROSC and the neurological outcome. Crit Care. 2020 Feb 22;24(1):60. doi: 10.1186/s13054-020-2762-5.

Sarıaydın T, Çorbacıoğlu ŞK, Çevik Y, Emektar E. Effect of initial lactate level on short-term survival in patients with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest. Turk J Emerg Med. 2017 May 15;17(4):123-127. doi: 10.1016/j.tjem.2017.05.003. eCollection 2017 Dec.
